metadata.title: CVE-2018-14337 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
The CHECK macro in mrbgems/mruby-sprintf/src/sprintf.c in mruby 1.4.1 contains a signed integer overflow, possibly leading to out-of-bounds memory access because the mrb_str_resize function in string.c does not check for a negative length.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-14337` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mruby - 2.0.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mruby package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.0-1').
